name: Tonkatsu
method: Season pork chops with salt and pepper
Coat each chop with flour
Dip each chop in beaten eggs
Coat each chop in panko bread crumbs
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat
Fry pork chops until golden brown on both sides
Drain on paper towels
Slice and serve with tonkatsu sauce

name: Miso Soup
method: Cut tofu into small cubes
Slice green onions diagonally
Cut nori into small pieces
In a pot, heat dashi stock until hot
Reduce heat to low
Take some of the hot stock and mix with miso paste
Add miso mixture to the pot
Add tofu and green onions
Simmer for 1-2 minutes
Add nori and turn off heat
Serve hot

name: Yakitori
method: Cut chicken into small pieces
Soak bamboo skewers in water for 30 minutes
Thread chicken onto skewers
In a small saucepan, combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar
Heat over medium heat until sugar dissolves
Grill chicken skewers over medium heat
Brush with sauce and turn occasionally
Grill until chicken is cooked through
Serve hot

name: Japanese Curry
method: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces
Chop onions, carrots, and potatoes into small chunks
In a large pot, saut√© the chicken until browned
Add vegetables and cook for 5 minutes
Add enough water to cover the ingredients, and bring to a boil
Lower heat and simmer until vegetables are tender
Add curry roux and stir until dissolved
Simmer until curry thickens
Serve with rice
